summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Metropolitan Detention Center, transmitting witness materials and discovery to inmate Ghislaine Maxwell for her criminal case.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Signs the letter as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, authorizing the transmission of discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The inmate at the Metropolitan Detention Center who is to receive witness materials and discovery related to her criminal case, United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: Strauss, as United States Attorney, is the prosecuting authority in the criminal case against Maxwell and is responsible for providing discovery materials to the defense.

events.title: Transmission of Discovery to Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sends witness materials and discovery to inmate Ghislaine Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center via Federal Express.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Metropolitan Detention Center, 80 29th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11232
keyFacts: The document is a formal correspondence from the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.
It confirms Ghislaine Maxwell was an inmate at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn as of July 2021.
The prosecution was actively providing discovery materials to Maxwell's defense team during her incarceration.
